alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 4:29PM MST until further notice by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arizona... Verde River above Clarkdale affecting Yavapai County. .Heavy rain and melting snow have lead to fast rising flows in rivers, which will reach critical levels. For the Verde River...including Clarkdale...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Verde River above Clarkdale. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, High flow could lead to bank erosion and water ponding in backwater catch basins. At 12.0 feet, Nuisance flooding of property along riverbanks. At 15.0 feet, Inundation of homes along Bates Road and Rio Verde RV park in Cottonwood begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM MST Wednesday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 14.2 feet early this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.0 feet on 08/01/2010. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (4 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Verde River Clarkdale 12.0 12.6 Wed 4 pm MST 7.8 4.5 3.3 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz
